linkTarget.anchoringText: Conduct engineering research in the conditions of permafrost due to the nature of the area requires further development and inclusion of additional studies, since the standard set of studies unable to identify potentially dangerous areas with a possible thawing in the process of drilling and exploitation. As a result of such interactions may form hopper sagging in testing parts of the holes (fig. 1), voids within the entire range of frozen rocks that leads to a rise in drilling operations, in addition, can lead to the loss of longitudinal stability of wells, and, as a consequence, to the accident.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Funnel sagging in estuarine parts of wells

formatted-caption.caption-text: Funnel sagging in estuarine parts of wells

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Fig. 2 shows contour lines of the values of precipitation caused by thawing of ice interlayers calculated for a soil layer with a capacity of 15m from the surface to the projected cluster pad Russian license area. This area is shown as an example, as it provides the most homogenous landscape conditions of the six sites examined during investigations. The figure shows that the values of volume loss soils even in homogeneous landscape settings differ by almost twice.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: the contour values of precipitation caused by thawing of ice interlayers Value A – absolute and B – relative rainfall during thawing soils top layer producing 15 m

formatted-caption.caption-text: the contour values of precipitation caused by thawing of ice interlayers Value A – absolute and B – relative rainfall during thawing soils top layer producing 15 m

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Fig. 3 shows the results of the work on one of the platforms in the area of Noviy Urengoy. At the time of the research at the site was completed with the erection of the mound. In Fig. 3A shows the schematic layout of platforms with contour of the terrain as prior to construction.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: The results of the electrical tomography on the projected sectional area in the region of Noviy Urengoy. A – layout of electrical tomography profiles B-D schematic geoelectric sections.

formatted-caption.caption-text: The results of the electrical tomography on the projected sectional area in the region of Noviy Urengoy. A – layout of electrical tomography profiles B-D schematic geoelectric sections.

linkTarget.anchoringText: As a result of geophysical works in the base platform was found buried the lake basin, the existence of which was later confirmed by drilling of exploratory wells. Green and yellow colors correspond to high impedance the host frozen sands with massive cryogenic texture. According to the project wells are expected to be placed on a line corresponding to the profile II (Fig. 3B) geophysical survey, on a fragment of a platform with high icy base and the guaranteed operation problems. Offset wells on 30 m on the profile IV (fig. 4 d) geophysical surveys greatly reduces the likelihood of operational problems.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: core sample high icy lake sediments at the base of cluster pad

formatted-caption.caption-text: core sample high icy lake sediments at the base of cluster pad

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Fig 5 shows the geological-geophysical section, clarifying the structure buried the lake basins in the considered above example based on engineering-geological wells and well log studies.

linkTarget.anchoringText: According to the results of interpretation of space images in the original version of the placement site is located in hummock-hollow swamp (the hollow of the flow) figure 6.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Reposition option pad 3 within permissible path terrain. Yellow-the original playgrounds, green recommended.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Reposition option pad 3 within permissible path terrain. Yellow-the original playgrounds, green recommended.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Reconnaissance surveillance and geophysical work has shown that the new situation is also problematic pad scrub. The North-West edge of the site overlaps the trough of the flow from a large lake and the area actually becomes the dam on the way a series of temporary and permanent watercourses. In particular, point of laying production well actually resides in the creek (Fig 7).

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: The nature of the surface cluster pad 3, the projected wells

formatted-caption.caption-text: The nature of the surface cluster pad 3, the projected wells

linkTarget.anchoringText: In General, complex hydrological situation in the area chosen for the construction for the construction of cluster pad 3 is clearly seen in multispectral photograph (fig 8). Pictured in purple and orange colors allocated plots of flooding.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: a fragment of a multispectral snapshot of the area of cluster pad 3.

formatted-caption.caption-text: a fragment of a multispectral snapshot of the area of cluster pad 3.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig 9 shows the nature of the geoelectric section of the base cluster pad 3, oriented in line VAT and extended outside the site in a South-easterly direction. The figure shows that the base platform is composed mainly of frozen Sands with subordinate value loams and loams. On a plot of strip flow, within which are the locations for all wells, probably came the thawing of the soil due to the action of surface water until thawed, or close to thawed state.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Geoelectrical section of the base cluster pad 3

formatted-caption.caption-text: Geoelectrical section of the base cluster pad 3
